name: The Hotel Cairns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Cairns for one day before and one day after a dive trip on the Spirit of Freedom, and it was perfect. The rooms were well appointed, the bed was really comfy and it was within walking distance of everything. They held our luggage during our dive trip and we got a free upgrade (to a spa room) on the second night. Breakfast was included with our room and it was a delicious way to start the day. There are many accommodation options in Cairns, and this was definitely the best value. We will be back!!
reviews.title: Great location, quiet rooms and delicious breakfast

reviews.text: The website shows a 4+ hotel which is in actually a 2. Upon arrival, with many bags as we were traveling from the States and staying for over 2 weeks, there was water cascading down from the balcony above the lobby check in. (I'm just going to number this..)
reviews.title: Checked in and right back out...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. No bellman to help with baggage
reviews.title: An elegant, plantation style hotel with a really good restaurant.
Just what the Doctor ordered!
reviews.text: 2. A front desk attendee who didn't really want to be doing her job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. STAIRS to the elevator with huge pieces of luggage and no one to help with them.
reviews.title: Nice Suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel sticks out in my mind as being the worst we stayed at on our trip (out of 5 hotels). The rooms are tatty and really need a make over. The sound proofing is poor so we had to resort to ear plugs. We tried breakfast on the first day and didn't bother again as it wasn't worth the effort. Some of the staff were really helpful, others made it clear that guests were too much trouble.
reviews.title: Tired & disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great position in Cairns, away from the noise but close enough to walk everywhere. The provision of Smart cars make exploring the area easy and fun.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I recommend the hotel? I am really not sure. It wasn't absolutely terrible, it just wasn't good enough.
reviews.title: Great hotel and terrific Smart Cars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in Feb 2009. I e-mailed and asked if they had any offers and I was offered and accepted 155$ a night for a plantation room to include breakfast.
reviews.title: Not a Bad Location, Comfortable, Good Value

reviews.text: When we arrived we were upgraded and had a large quiet ground floor room with an outside patio.However, the room had a musty/stale cigarette smell . We complained and staff put a dehumidifier type machine in whilst we were out on a trip and on our return the smell had disappeared.
reviews.title: Nice Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just had to tell you about the amazing Smart cars they have three at The Hotel Cairns. They
reviews.title: Amazing Mercedes-Benz New Smart cars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: are just fantastic for seeing the surrounding areas and the best thing is you get free use of
reviews.title: Great Hotel & staff, a Cairns treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one when you stay at The hotel. You really should give them a call to secure your room and car for your up and coming Trip to Cairns.
reviews.title: A great value Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were returning customers & had enjoyed a previous stay. the hotel is well located a short walk from the promenade & CBD/restaurants etc. Its a great Colonial style design with a pool nestled in tropical gardens.
reviews.title: Wish we had more time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean, well equipped & functional, but one aspect that stands out over others is the friendliness & helpfulness of the staff & nothing seemed to much trouble.
reviews.title: Very Decent Hotel - clean, good location - would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an Ad in the Local Paper for special getaway which incl $90 food voucher....Best location ..used to be the old Country Comfort Inn but has been totally refiurbished
reviews.title: Great Hotel with special Dinner package AU$100.- couldn't beat that

reviews.text: This hotel was a major disappointment. At check-in, we were not acknowledged for a couple minutes, and when we were the impression was that we were somehow interrupting. The check-in process went quite quickly, however. We had reserved a tower block room and had requested a quiet room when we booked through the hotel’s website. The room itself is best described as dingy and the floor especially looked like it could use a good polishing. The bathroom was not only in need of a serious update (chipped, stained corian, very old fixtures), but it also needed a pretty thorough clean to get rid of the mildew in and around the tub. Molton Brown toiletries are advertised and there were bottles of shower gel/shampoo and conditioner fixed to the shower wall, but other toiletries were not Molton Brown. The Hotel itself is more of a motel than hotel in layout, and is nicely landscaped. We did not swim in the pool, and while small, it looked clean. As part of our reservation, we received $100 off dinner in their restaurant, The Plantation. The meal and service were both wonderful. I’d highly recommend the steak (which you cook yourself on a hot stone) and the barramundi. The desserts are okay—they seem to be going for presentation over taste. I’d eat here again. Our disappointment with the room grew when we returned that evening. The “clean” coffee cups had the dregs of someone else’s coffee in them and the AC was too loud to sleep through. Although we had requested a room in the quiet part of the hotel, noise from the road below kept us awake. Furthermore, the pretty but impractical wooden blinds meant that the sunshine was very poorly blocked. The perks (money off dinner, use of a smartcar) are nice ideas, but I’d much rather see that money put towards cleaning, updating, and soundproofing the rooms. I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big beautiful hotel just a short walk from city centre. Good base if you are going around for day trips.
reviews.title: Beautiful but noisy - great smart cars

reviews.text: Rooms are very average but clean. Good big fridge in room and nice big enough laundry downstairs. Hated the pillows...
reviews.title: Smart Accommodation BUT Outside Rooms Have Vulnerability to Noise, Impractical Facilities AND Privacy Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lot of traffic & bird noise during nights. Pool is very small
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel ..

description: The Hotel Cairns, with its impeccably private and tropical ambience, is a 4 star resort hotel superbly positioned in the central business district of Cairns, one block from the famous Esplanade. Its architectural profile and exterior facade is one of the most beautiful examples of Queenslander heritage style, and is a popular talking point among many of the hotel’s visitors and guests. The hotel has undergone a complete remodeling and refurbishment to emerge as the classic accommodation of choice in Tropical North Queensland. Privately owned and operated by an Australian family, the Bakers, The Hotel Cairns is popular with international and domestic visitors and locals from the Cairns hinterland who appreciate quality and attention to detail. Set back from the street and well shaded by tropical trees and plants, The Hotel Cairns features a tour booking desk, a sparkling blue outdoor pool and spa, a modern, state of the art cardio gymnasium, a choice of function rooms, an onsite car park and a welcoming indoor/outdoor restaurant, The Plantation Bar & Grill. The Hotel Cairns is conveniently located just 10 minutes drive from the Airport, and an easy 5 minutes walking distance to shops and eateries in Cairns’ CBD.
